page.title: 12LEGENDS OF ROCHE ROCK
page.content: {Roche Rock}towers above the heathland a large granite mass with the ruins of a Chapel on the top can be seen for miles around.The Chapel, named after St.Michael is early 15th century and was built after the fashion of a 3 tiered Cornish tower. The upper room was the Chapel with the lower accomodating the Chaplain. Under its floor, cut into the bed-rock, it is said there is a hermit's cell. One version of the legend of{Jan {Tregeagle}says that when fleeing from the Devil, he gained refuge by sticking his head in through the east window of the Chapel. The Rock provided sanctuary for the last member of the Tregarrick family, said to be a{leper}who was tended by his daughter, who brought him water each day from a now vanished well beneath the Rock.
